def sanitise_headers(filepath, targetpath):

    ### imports
    import pandas as pd 
    import re

    ### opening file
    targetpath += filepath.split(".windows.net/")[1].split(".xlsx")[0] + '.snappy.parquet'
    df = pd.read_parquet(targetpath)

    ### reading column names and sanitising for parquet format
    cols = df.columns
    cols=[re.sub("( |\#|\# |\.|\(|\)|\/)","_",i) for i in cols] # replace chars with _
    cols=[re.sub("([\_]{2,})","_",i) for i in cols] #replace consecutive _ with one _
    cols=[re.sub("(\_)$","",i) for i in cols] #remove trailing _
    df.columns = cols

    ### changing all types to string - makes life easier
    df = df.astype(str)

    ### writing file
    df.to_parquet(targetpath)
